author: KenP
message:
It looks good and less 'in-your-face' than default plasma notifications. However, I don't see progress bars anymore for things like file transfers, downloads etc.

Is there a way to enable those?

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message: This is weird: you should always get progress information, either as a Plasma extender (as before) or as an old-style dialog. Which version of KDE SC do you use?

author: Dion Moult
message: Might consider this if they still refuse to make the default notification style smaller. It's taking up a good third of my screen!

author: manolin
message: Can you implemented actions? even if they are disabled by default? thanks.

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message: Actions go in the way of the click-through feature of Colibri. I have some ideas in mind to work-around this, but haven't had time to play with them yet.

author: lelamal
message:
It would be nice to see Colibri implemented on KDE by default. Plasma notifications seem so out of place, these days, within the Plasma desktop clashing with all its transparency and, now, its blur effect, and with its smooth effects (graphical effects, thumbnails transitions, etc). Is there any chance Colibri gets an active notification system to cover such functionalities as progress information and buttons integration?

Also, any plans to provide a PPA in order to use always the latest version available, please? I tried to compile the source files, but have never done that, and I get an endless list of errors. Many thanks for you work on Colibri!
